title: Authors and Citation
text: Manuel Spínola (2023). crgeo: Geospatial data Costa Rica. R package version 0.1.0. Available https://github.com/ManuelSpinola/crgeo.
code: @Manual{,   title = {crgeo: Geospatial data of Costa Rica},   author = {Manuel Spínola},   year = {2023},   url = {https://github.com/ManuelSpinola/crgeo}, }

title: crgeo: Geospatial data of Costa Rica
text: goal crgeo provide geospatial data Costa Rica

title: crgeo: Geospatial data of Costa Rica
text: can install development version crgeo GitHub :

title: crgeo: Geospatial data of Costa Rica
text: basic example use data package:
code: library(crgeo) library(tidyverse) library(sf) library(stars) ggplot(cr_outline) +   geom_sf(fill = "dodgerblue4", color = "gray") +   theme_minimal() ggplot() +   geom_stars(data = cr_elevation_c) +   scale_fill_viridis_c(name = "Altura (m)", na.value = "transparent") +   theme_minimal() +   coord_equal()

what: Estimated population density per grid-cell (people/kmˆ2) of Costa Rica 2020 (only continent, without islands) — cr_pop_density_2020_1km_c
title: Estimated population density per grid-cell (people/kmˆ2) of Costa Rica 2020 (only continent, without islands) — cr_pop_density_2020_1km_c
text: Estimated population density per grid-cell Costa Rica 2020 resolution 30 arc (approximately 1km equator). projection Geographic Coordinate System, WGS84. units number people per square kilometer. mapping approach Random Forest-based dasymetric redistribution.
